trans-unit.source: Represents a localizable resource in a [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] stream.
The BamlLocalizableResource class is the value component of the key-value pairs found in a <xref:System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizationDictionary>.
## XAML Text Usage
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResource"></xref> class.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResource"></xref> class, with the specified localizable value, localization comments, resource category, localization lock status, and visibility of the resource.
The localizable value.
Comments used for localizing.
The string category of the resource.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the resource should be modifiable; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the resource should be visible for translation purposes because it is potentially readable as text in the UI; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the localization category of a resource.
## XAML Text Usage
The localization category, as a value of the enumeration.
Gets or sets the localization comments associated with a resource.
Localization comments are authored by the developer to provide rules or hints for localizers.
The comments are free-form strings that are extracted from [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_baml](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-baml-md.md)] or from localization comments files.

To attach comments to an element in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)], use the <xref:System.Windows.Localization.Comments%2A?displayProperty=fullName> attached property For more information on this attached property, see [Localization Attributes and Comments](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
## XAML Text Usage
The localization comment string.
Gets or sets the localizable content.
The localizable content string.
Determines whether a specified <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResource"></xref> object is equal to this object.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Markup.Localizer.BamlLocalizableResource"></xref> object test for equality.
if other is equal to this object; otherwise, .
Returns an integer hash code representing this instance.
An integer hash code.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the localizable resource is modifiable.
## XAML Text Usage
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the resource is modifiable; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets whether the resource is visible for translation.
The Readable value serves as a recommendation to the localizer about whether the content of the localizable resource can be directly translated as plain strings.
For example, when the string "Red" is used as a UI string, it can be directly translated to another language.
In this case the Readable property should be set to `true`.
When the string "Red" is used as a predefined color value of a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Brush>, it cannot be translated.
Therefore the Readable property should be set to `false`.
## XAML Text Usage
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the resource is visible for translation; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
